I also found that training does not go well when nn.DataParallel wrapper is used with cuDNN RNN modules.
It prints warnings which say parameters are not flattened, and the aspect of loss changes of the multi-GPU case is not similar to that of the single-GPU case.
I think this problem is possibly related to the problem you stated.

body:
I also found that training does not go well when `nn.DataParallel` wrapper is used with cuDNN RNN modules.
It prints warnings which say parameters are not flattened, and the aspect of loss changes of the multi-GPU case is not similar to that of the single-GPU case.
I think this problem is possibly related to the problem you stated.
